sen.e: The Osaka Conference is a meeting which took place in Osaka Prefecture on February 11, 1875 and where the dignitaries of the Meiji government including Toshimichi OKUBO, Takayoshi KIDO and Taisuke ITAGAKI got together to discuss the government's prospective policy (for establishing constitutional government) and the appointment of Sangi (councillors).

sen.j: 大久保を中心に岩倉具視・大隈重信・伊藤博文らが政府の再編を行うが、直後に台湾出兵をめぐる意見が対立、その結果、長州閥のトップ木戸孝允までが職を去る事態に陥り、ほぼ大久保専制体制となる。

sen.j: 大久保主導政府の急進的な改革に対する不満が、全国で顕在化し、佐賀の乱はじめ各地で士族の反乱、鹿児島県においては私学校党による県政の壟断を招き、また板垣らは愛国公党を結成して自由民権運動を始動した。
sen.e: Discontent with the radical reforms made by the Okubo government manifested itself all over the country.

sen.e: His plan was to explain the need to immediately establish a parliament to Kido, who originally had enlightened ideas and had been positive for the implementation of a parliamentary system, with the aim to have Okubo adopt a constitutional system as the government's policy through Kido's proposal.

sen.e: His plan was to explain the need to immediately establish a parliament to Kido, who by nature had enlightened ideas and was proactively supportive of the implementation of a parliamentary system, aiming to use Kido to convince Okubo to adopt a constitutional system as the government's policy.

sen.j: 大久保は当初、議会制（立憲政治・政党政治など）の導入に対しては消極的であった。

sen.j: なぜなら次のようなことが想定できたからである。

sen.j: 第一に、欧米列強の圧力に対抗するための根本的な法整備や国力増進のためには、天皇の権威のもとで薩長が権力を集積し、一貫した政策を継続できる現体制のほうが現実的であること。

First, in order to establish a basic legal system and increase national power to resist the pressures of the Western powers, the existent system was more practical as it would enable them to consolidate the powers of Satsuma and Choshu factions to carry out consistent policies under the authority of the emperor.

First, in order to establish a basic legal system and increase national power to resist the pressures of the Western powers, the existent system was more practical as it would enable them to consolidate the powers of Satsuma and Choshu factions to carry out consistent policies under the authority of the emperor.

sen.j: 第二に、『自由民権運動』の看板を掲げながら、思想よりはむしろ感情で行動する失業士族の多い当時の日本の国情を踏まえれば、『政党政治の早期断行には「小党分立による国政の迷走」というリスクが伴う』こと。

sen.cmt: 原文通り一文にまとめました。
sen.e: On this occasion, however, they did not discuss politics but only enjoyed dinner and pleasant talks (according to "Hokobiroi" and other sources).

sen.j: しかし、1ヶ月におよぶ議論の妥結を喜んだ木戸は、舞台となった料亭・加賀伊の店名を「花外楼」と改名することを提案、みずから看板を揮毫した。
sen.e: Pleased with the compromises made after the discussions they had over a month, Kido suggested that the restaurant's name should be changed to 'Kagairo.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Pleased that they had reached an agreement after all the discussions they had had over a month, Kido suggested that the restaurant's name be renamed 'Kagairo,' and he calligraphed the name on its signboard by himself.
sen.cmt: 原文通り一文にまとめました。
sen.e: Pleased that they had reached an agreement after all the discussions they had had over a month, Kido suggested that the restaurant's name be renamed 'Kagairo,' and he calligraphed the name on its signboard by himself.

sen.j: 三者合意による政体改革案は、ただちに太政大臣三条実美に提出され、3月に木戸・板垣は参議へ復帰することとなった。
sen.e: The proposed political reforms on which the three agreed was immediately submitted to Sanetomi SANJO the Dajo Daijin (Grand Minister).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The proposition for political reforms which had been agreed on by the three was immediately submitted to Sanetomi SANJO, the Dajo Daijin (Grand Minister), and the comeback of Kido and Itagaki as Sangi was scheduled in March.
sen.cmt: 原文通り一文にまとめました。
sen.e: The proposition for political reforms which had been agreed on by the three was immediately submitted to Sanetomi SANJO, the Dajo Daijin (Grand Minister), and the comeback of Kido and Itagaki as Sangi was scheduled in March.

sen.j: 合意に基づき、さっそく4月14日には明治天皇より「立憲政体の詔書」が発せられ、元老院 (日本)・大審院・地方官会議を設置し、段階的に立憲政体を立てることが宣言された。
sen.e: Based on the agreement, Emperor Meiji issued 'an imperial edict on constitutional government' on April 14.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Based on the agreement, the Emperor Meiji issued 'an imperial edict on constitutional government' on April 14 to declare that 'Genroin' (a Senate in Japan), 'Daishin-in' (a predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan) and 'Chihokan Kaigi' (an Assembly of Prefectural Governors) should be established with a view to the gradual formation of constitutional government.
sen.cmt: 原文通り本文と次の文を一文にまとめました。
sen.e: Based on the agreement, the Emperor Meiji issued 'an imperial edict on constitutional government' on April 14 to declare that 'Genroin' (a Senate in Japan), 'Daishin-in' (a predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan) and 'Chihokan Kaigi' (an Assembly of Prefectural Governors) should be established with a view to the gradual formation of constitutional government.

sen.j: いっぽう板垣は参議就任により、愛国社創立運動の失敗を招いたため、自由民権派から背信行為を厳しく糾弾され、釈明に追われることとなった。
sen.e: Assuming the office of Sangi, Itagaki caused the movement for the formation of Aikokusha to fail.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, Itagaki's assumption of office as Sangi caused the movement of the formation of Aikokusha (literally, the Society of Patriots) to fail, so he was severely criticized by the Jiyu Minken fraction for his betrayal and pressed to offer vindication.
sen.cmt: 原文通り本文と次の２文を一文にまとめました。
sen.e: On the other hand, Itagaki's assumption of office as Sangi caused the movement of the formation of Aikokusha (literally, the Society of Patriots) to fail, so he was severely criticized by the Jiyu Minken fraction for his betrayal and pressed to offer vindication.

sen.j: 大阪会議体制の崩壊
sen.e: Collapse of the Osaka Conference System
Collapse of the Osaka Conference System
Collapse of the Osaka Conference System

sen.j: 難産の末に確立された新体制であったが、ほどなく地方官会議の権限をめぐって木戸と板垣が対立するようになる。
sen.e: Thus the new system was born after a hard labor, but it was not long before Kido and Itagaki disagreed on the power of the Assembly of Prefectural Governors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Thus, the new system was established after considerable difficulty, but it was not long before Kido and Itagaki clashed over the issue of the power of the Assembly of Prefectural Governors; at last their confrontation had become irrevocable at the issue of separating the Councillors from the Ministers.
sen.cmt: 難産を意訳しました。原文通り本文と次の２文を一文にまとめました。
sen.e: Thus, the new system had been established only after considerable difficulty, but it was not long before Kido and Itagaki clashed over the issue of the power of the Assembly of Prefectural Governors.

sen.j: さらに参議と各省の卿の分離問題で、両者は決定的な対立を迎える。
sen.e: They stood in decisive opposition concerning the issue of separating the Councillors from the Ministers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They stood in decisive opposition concerning the issue of separating the Councillors from the Ministers.
In the end, they fell into open conflict over the issue of separating the Councillors from the Ministers.

sen.j: 折から発生した江華島事件の処理をめぐる意見対立も重なり、板垣はついに参議を辞任。
sen.e: Coupled with their conflicting opinions about the handling of the Ganghwa Island incident which had just taken place, Itagaki resigned from the office of Sangi.
Discord over how to handle the Ganghwa Island incident, which had just taken place, worsened the situation, and finally Itagaki resigned from the office of Sangi.
Discord over how to handle the Ganghwa Island incident, which had just taken place, worsened the situation, and finally Itagaki resigned from the office of Sangi.

sen.j: 大阪会議体制はわずか半年にして崩壊する。
sen.e: Only six months later, the Osaka Conference system collapsed.
It was only six months after its establishment that the Osaka Conference system collapsed.
It was only six months after its establishment that the Osaka Conference system collapsed.

sen.j: 板垣とセットで入閣した木戸の発言力も必然的に下がり、さらにこの頃より持病の悪化から表立った政治活動を行いにくくなったこともあり、木戸の政府内での地位も低下した。
sen.e: Joining the cabinet with Itagaki, Kido inevitably lost his influence.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kido, who had joined the cabinet with Itagaki, inevitably lost his influence, and in addition his chronic illness, which had aggravated around this time, hindered his political activities; thus his position in the government also went down.
sen.cmt: 原文通り本文と次の２文を一文にまとめました。
sen.e: Kido, who had joined the cabinet with Itagaki, inevitably lost his influence, and in addition his chronic illness, which had aggravated around this time, hindered his political activities; thus his position in the government also went down.

sen.j: 一時期板垣と連携する動きを見せた左大臣・島津久光までもが辞表を提出し、岩倉・大久保らが主導権を握る体制に戻った。
sen.e: Hisamitsu SHIMAZU the Minister of the Left who appeared to work together with Itagaki at a time also resigned.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Minister of the Left, Hisamitsu SHIMAZU, who had shown an attitude to cooperate with Itagaki at a time, also resigned; consequently the old regime led by Iwakura and Okubo was restored.
sen.cmt: 原文通り本文と次の２文を一文にまとめました。
sen.e: The Minister of the Left, Hisamitsu SHIMAZU, who had shown an attitude to cooperate with Itagaki at a time, also resigned; consequently the old regime led by Iwakura and Okubo was restored.

sen.j: ここに大阪会議で決定された新体制は完全に崩壊。
sen.e: The new system determined at the Osaka Conference completely broke down.
The new system determined at the Osaka Conference completely broke down.
The new system determined at the Osaka Conference completely broke down.

sen.j: 結果として大阪会議以前の大久保の独裁体制が、より強化された形で復活したといえる。
sen.e: As a result, Okubo's former despotic system was revived in a more powerful form.
As a result, Okubo's former despotic system was revived in a more powerful form.
As a result, Okubo's former despotic system was revived in a more powerful form.

sen.j: ただし、将来的な立憲政体・議会政治の方向性が示されたという点においては、それなりの意義があった会議であったとも言える。
sen.e: The Conference was of some significance, however, as it showed where constitutional and parliamentary government would go in the future.
However, at the point that the direction toward constitutional and parliamentary government was indicated for the future, it can be said that the conference was of some significance.
However, it can be said that the conference was of some significance in that it helped indicate the future direction of constitutional and parliamentary government.
